candidates.definition: Sports and recreational activities performed on snow or ice during cold weather conditions.

positive_examples: The Olympic figure skating competition was breathtaking to watch.
We went skiing in the Alps during our winter vacation.
The curling team practiced their sweeping technique on the ice rink.
Ice skating lessons help children develop balance and coordination.
The ski resort opened early due to excellent snow conditions.
She performed a perfect triple axel during her figure skating routine.
negative_examples: The swimming competition was held at the indoor pool.
He scored three goals during the hockey game.
The tennis match was postponed due to rain.
Beach volleyball requires excellent teamwork and communication.
The basketball team practiced free throws in the gymnasium.
She ran a marathon through the city streets last weekend.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: WaterSports, TeamSports, TrackAndField, BallSports, CombatSports

candidates.definition: Sports involving direct physical confrontation or simulated fighting between opponents.

positive_examples: The boxing match ended in a knockout in the third round.
She earned her black belt in karate after years of training.
The wrestling tournament featured competitors from around the world.
He practiced his sword techniques at the fencing academy.
The mixed martial arts fighter submitted his opponent with a chokehold.
The judo throw sent her opponent flying across the mat.
negative_examples: The football team scored a touchdown in the final seconds.
She hit a perfect serve to win the tennis match.
The basketball player made a three-point shot from downtown.
He swam the butterfly stroke in the Olympic finals.
The soccer goalie made an incredible diving save.
The track athlete broke the world record in the 100 meters.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: TeamSports, RacketSports, WaterSports, TrackAndField

candidates.definition: Sports played with hand-held implements used to strike a ball or shuttlecock across a playing area

positive_examples: She won the tennis championship with a powerful forehand
The badminton player made a spectacular overhead smash
He practiced his squash serves in the enclosed court
The ping-pong tournament featured incredible rallies
She joined the racquetball league at her local gym
The tennis coach taught proper grip technique
negative_examples: The baseball player swung his bat at the fastball
She kicked the soccer ball into the goal
He threw a perfect spiral in football practice
The basketball team practiced their free throws
She served an ace in the volleyball match
The golf club made contact with the ball on the tee
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: TeamSports, WaterSports, CombatSports, TrackAndField

candidates.definition: Sports that involve aiming at and hitting specific targets for points or accuracy.

positive_examples: She drew back her bow and aimed carefully at the bullseye.
His golf shot landed precisely on the green near the pin.
The bowling ball struck all ten pins for a perfect strike.
He steadied his rifle and fired at the clay pigeon.
The archer's arrow hit the center ring for maximum points.
She lined up her putt to sink the ball in the hole.
negative_examples: The soccer player kicked the ball into the goal.
She served the tennis ball across the net to her opponent.
The swimmer dove into the pool for the freestyle race.
He tackled the quarterback before he could throw the pass.
The basketball player dribbled down the court toward the hoop.
She caught the fly ball in her glove during the baseball game.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: TeamSports, RacingSports, CombatSports, WaterSports

candidates.definition: Sports that involve animals as active participants or central elements of the competition

positive_examples: She won the equestrian jumping competition on her mare.
The Kentucky Derby is one of the most famous horse races in America.
He spent the weekend fishing in the tournament at the lake.
The polo match featured skilled riders and well-trained horses.
She trained her dog for the agility competition next month.
The rodeo featured bull riding and barrel racing events.
negative_examples: The football team practiced on the field every morning.
She lifted weights at the gym to build muscle strength.
The tennis match went into overtime with intense rallies.
He scored three goals in the soccer game yesterday.
The basketball tournament had sixteen competing teams.
They ran a marathon through the city streets.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: TeamSports, IndividualSports, WaterSports, WinterSports

candidates.definition: Sports involving competitive or recreational activities performed on wheeled equipment like bicycles, skates, or skateboards.

positive_examples: She won the gold medal in speed skating at the Olympics.
The BMX racing championship drew thousands of spectators.
He practiced skateboarding tricks at the local skate park.
The cycling tour covered 200 miles through mountain terrain.
Roller derby teams competed fiercely for the regional title.
Street skateboarding requires incredible balance and creativity.
negative_examples: The marathon runner crossed the finish line exhausted.
She dove gracefully into the swimming pool.
The tennis match went into five grueling sets.
He scored the winning goal in overtime soccer.
The gymnast performed a perfect vault routine.
They played basketball until the court lights came on.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: WaterSports, BallSports, CombatSports, Athletics

candidates.definition: Sports that primarily emphasize physical strength, power, and muscular development through resistance training or bodyweight exercises.

positive_examples: She spent hours at the gym doing deadlifts and squats to build her physique for the bodybuilding competition.
The gymnast's routine on the rings required incredible upper body strength and control.
His powerlifting training focused on maximizing his one-rep max in bench press, squat, and deadlift.
The CrossFit athlete excelled in strength-based movements like muscle-ups and heavy lifts.
Olympic weightlifters train for years to perfect their snatch and clean-and-jerk techniques.
The gymnast's floor routine showcased amazing tumbling skills and muscular power.
negative_examples: The marathon runner focused on building cardiovascular endurance rather than muscle mass.
She played tennis every weekend to improve her hand-eye coordination and agility.
The basketball team worked on their passing drills and shooting accuracy.
He joined the swimming team to develop better technique and speed in the water.
The soccer players practiced their footwork and ball handling skills.
The track and field sprinter worked on explosive speed and running form.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: EnduranceSports, TeamSports, RacketSports, WaterSports

candidates.definition: High-risk recreational activities performed in challenging natural environments requiring specialized skills and equipment.

positive_examples: She spent the weekend rock climbing at Red Rock Canyon.
The caving expedition explored deep limestone caverns.
He's training for a multi-pitch climbing route in Yosemite.
The spelunking club discovered a new underground chamber.
They went bouldering at the local climbing gym.
The cave rescue team practiced rope techniques underground.
negative_examples: She went hiking on the mountain trail.
The team practiced rock throwing for track and field.
He enjoys casual nature walks in the park.
They went swimming in the mountain lake.
She collects rocks and minerals as a hobby.
The geology class studied cave formations.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: TeamSports, WaterSports, WinterSports, TrackAndField, Gymnastics
